reasoning: PARK6 (PINK1-related) early-onset Parkinson disease is a rare autosomal recessive genetic form. Reported prevalence ~0.08 per 100k based on genetic epidemiology studies showing PINK1 mutations account for <1% of familial PD cases. Moderate confidence due to limited population-based epidemiological data; primarily documented in genetic registries and research cohorts.
source: Valente EM et al. Hereditary Early-Onset Parkinson's Disease Caused by Mutations in PINK1. Science. 2004;304(5674):1158-60. Kitada T et al. Mutations in the Parkin gene cause autosomal recessive juvenile parkinsonism. Nature. 1998;392(6676):605-8.
